alert.note: Alert for Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 5:22PM CDT until June 17 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following counties, DeSoto, Marshall and Tate. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southaven, Hernando, Holly Springs, Byhalia, Marianna, Red Banks, Lewisburg, Watson, Wakefield, Rockhill, Victoria, New Garden, Cockrum, Mahon, Lurline, Alphaba, Gilton, Bright, Love and Higdon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
